reviews.review_msg: Chung-Hye Han is a very good teacher, but the course material is very difficult and confusing. At least for me, she did not make the material any easier to understand; most of the things I learned were from the textbook.

Syntax is difficult for me but Professor Han's explanations are generally clear and straightforward. Weekly tutorials are for presentations and lectures being online videos helped with being able to go back and revisit material, but do stay up-to-date each week as it's really easy to fall behind. Definitely need to put in a lot of time to do well.
Semantics with Dr. Han was more difficult than syntax.. There was a lot of math involved. The materials were basically similar to syntax but be prepared to do the math.

Exams were online and given extra time so basically very easy. Attendance is not mandatory but there were participation marks (they can also be gained by research participation). There were online recorded lectures, and all slides were posted on canvas. Lectures were clear, grades fair, Dr. Han was kind and patient and would explain everything.
Took course in hybrid format. Stay on top of lectures + homework and you'll do great. Textbook optional, everything required is covered in lectures.
Lectures + Do the assigned homework and you'll do great
Chung-hye Han was a great professor for this class. She is very knowledgeable about Syntax, and explained concepts well. I would definitely take this class again with her.

(had Han with LING 222 too) The topics about Propositional logics, truth conditions etc... Is difficult for me , but she was able to keep me engaged on the topic.  She would go through all the examples with us, and makes sure we understand. Unlike other professors who give us data and expect us to solve it on our own. Assign are completion based

She is very helpful. The materials provided were very very very well-related. Some of the midterms were quite hard and some are fairly easy! You need to read the lecture notes carefully and do lots of practise. I'd suggest to go to her office hours, you'd definitely find it way MORE helpful and.. clearer than just sitting in her lecturer room.

She is such a nice professor. I love the way she teaches,her exams were ok, not hard, just do the assignments and you will be fine, however, you have to go to every class in order to understand the material. So far, she is one of my favourite profs. in linguistics.

simila policy and rules as her other class.attendance is not marked. however, attend lecture will help a lot. Exams are quite fair. exams and homework are well related. so do more practice before the exams will help a lot.
she is such nice and kind teacher. you must attend her lectures in order to get everything clear and understood. Her exams are very well related to the homework and practice do in class.
Han has a very nice personality. Course context itself is very inspiring and interesting.
Nice personality. Reads directly off of powerpoint slides. Did not cause me to think about materials. Portions of the material covered did not seem relative.

I was not at all impressed with her teaching style. She was inconsistent, disorganized, and all together useless. Coming to class was a pain - her teaching method definitely needs work. There were plenty of opportunities for interesting discussion or debate, but she always stopped short of anything productive.
She shows you many videos and clearly explains the questions students ask. I would take her class again : )
nice prof., very organized, lecture notes were straightforward, unfortunately there really is no need to attend the classes because everything that's on the tests are straight out of her powerpoints.
A very nice person, but it seemed that there's no point of attending the lectures because she only reads off the powerpoint... simply read the text and you'll be fine.

I would say Han teaches ling322 better than ling324. During the lectures for ling322, she explained everything well in her own words. However, in ling324, she reads off from the powerpoint most of the time. Exams are tough. I love the course tho.
Awesome, dedicated prof -- friendly and helpful, and always willing to explain.
Her exams were so hard that lots of students have failed in her class this semester.
She is one great professor. Her lecture notes were great. Her classes was full of good information. She makes complicated things simple!!
She's a nice person.  But the course is hard.
Excellent organization and lecture note.  A nice prof.
No Comments
pretty good and easy course

She's nice, but maybe a little too accomodating to students. The exams are a little tough, but if you have the concepts down you should be fine. If you have a backround in predicate/propositional logic, this class is a total breeze. And she's kinda cute.
seems very interested in the course. unfair tests - very limited time with too many questions. trys hard to impress students
Very hard to get a really high mark since the percentage for A's are really high
her exams fet harder and harder, pure memorization, hated it
Organized, efficient & tries hard to please
Pretty good class.
No Comments
